intro: Chelidonium luteum, commonly known as the yellow greater celandine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes罂粟 (poppy) species, and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has alternate, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are radially symmetrical and consist of numerous stamens surrounding a central pistil. Chelidonium luteum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
